page.title: 20How It Was Done
page.content: Wadhurst Primary School was given an area to survey which involved a ten-minute car drive from the school. During a week when many of the children's school friends were visiting France, the teachers managed to borrow two minibuses from Uplands Community College (Wadhurst Secondary Comprehensive School), so that thirty children were able to "saturate" the area in a five-day period. So the children unable to visit France felt that the Domesday Project had proved an excellent and enjoyable substitute! { { { This section is the {work of those children (aged 9-ll) {and their teachers, David Reeder and {George Richardson, who edited it.
